title: Hannibal Hamlin
summary: Hannibal Hamlin (August 27, 1809 â€“ July 4, 1891) was an American attorney and politician from Maine. In a public service career spanning over 50 years, he served as the 15th vice president of the United States. The first Republican to hold the office, Hamlin served from 1861 to 1865. He is considered among the most influential politicians from Maine.
